import java.util.*;
public class Main { 
public static int binarySearch(int[] arr, int target,int s,int e) {
	if(s>e) {
	   System.out.println("Element not found in the given array,Please write the correct data");

		return -1;
	//	System.out.println("Element not found in the given array,Please write the correct data");
	}
	int m =s+(e-s)/2;
	if(arr[m]==target) {
		return m;
	}
	if(target>arr[m]) {
		return binarySearch(arr,target,m+1,e);
	}
	return binarySearch(arr,target,s,m-1);
	
}
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
   int  [] arr= {2,5,8,9,10,15,17,25,56,89,100};
   Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
   System.out.println("Enter the Target element which one you want to find in the given array");
   int target =sc.nextInt();
 //int target =22;
 System.out.println("Element found at index" +" "+ binarySearch(arr,target,0,arr.length-1));
}

}
